meanings.definition: To engage in deceitful or fraudulent behavior, especially for personal gain.
meanings.sent1: The con artist mountebanked his way into the trust of unsuspecting victims.
meanings.sent2: She mountebanked her way into getting a promotion by lying about her qualifications.
meanings.sent3: The sneaky fox mountebanked his way into stealing all the chickens from the farm.
meanings.sent4: The dishonest salesman mountebanked his way into convincing customers to buy faulty products.
meanings.sent5: The cunning thief mountebanked his way into the vault and stole all the jewels.

meanings.sent1: The magician mountebanked the audience with his disappearing act.
meanings.sent2: He mountebanked his friends into believing he had won the lottery.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous child mountebanked his little sister into thinking her toys were alive.
meanings.sent4: The clever spy mountebanked the enemy agents with his disguise.
meanings.sent5: The prankster mountebanked his classmates by pretending to be the teacher.

meanings.definition: A person who deceives others, especially for profit.
meanings.sent1: The mountebanked was known for his elaborate scams that fooled many people.
meanings.sent2: She realized too late that the charming man she met was a mountebanked.
meanings.sent3: The town was full of mountebanks trying to sell fake potions as miracle cures.
meanings.sent4: The mountebanked convinced the villagers to invest in a fake gold mine.
meanings.sent5: Beware of the smooth-talking mountebanked who promises quick riches.
